questions.question: 1. Which of the following is true for IGBT:

answers.a: It is a minority carrier device
answers.b: It is a majority carrier device
answers.c: It is a three layer device
answers.d: Its lightly doped n-region is connected to its collector

explanations.a: Explanation 1: IGBT is a minority carrier device as it operates mainly on the principle of controlling the flow of minority carriers (holes).

questions.question: 2. The transfer characteristics of IGBT is a plot between:

explanations.b: Explanation 2: Transfer characteristics of IGBT shows the relation between the Gate-to-Emitter voltage and the Collector current.

questions.question: 3. An IGBT is in ON- state. It is observed that with increasing collector-to-emitter voltage (V<sub>CE</sub>) the collector current (I<sub>C</sub>) is almost constant. Which region is the IGBT operating in?

explanations.c: Explanation 3: When IGBT is in saturation mode, its collector current remains constant.

questions.question: 4. When compared to MOSFET  the time required to turn- OFF an IGBT is?

explanations.c: Explanation 3: IGBT turn- OFF time is greater than MOSFET due to the presence of tail current.

questions.question: 5. A positive DC voltage is applied across the collector-to-emitter of an IGBT. It is then switched- ON using gate voltage. A DC current then starts flowing through the device. After sometime the gate signal is stopped. What is the status of IGBT?

answers.c: IGBT continues to conduct (Forward conducting state).

explanations.d: Explanation 4: IGBT is turned- OFF when gate pulse is withdrawn.

questions.question: 6. A forward biased IGBT comes into conduction state by?

explanations.c: Explanation 3: IGBT comes into conduction when gate-to-emitter voltage above the threshold value is given.

questions.question: 7. In comparison to MOSFET the losses in IGBT are?

explanations.b: Explanation 2: IGBT has lower ON-state resistance and hence lower conduction losses compared to MOSFET.

questions.question: 8. How can a conducting IGBT be brought to OFF-state?

answers.a: By application of positive collector current (I<sub>C</sub>)
answers.c: By reducing the gate voltage (V<sub>GE</sub>) to zero.

explanations.d: Explanation 4: IGBT is turned- OFF when gate pulse is removed.
